Hi,
    I just thought I'd pop up and reasure the group that I do still 
ex=
ist...

    I've been distracted by:

1) summer
2) getting promoted at work=

3) a long and complex video game that I kinda started playing and am 
dete=
rmined to complete
4) sort-of starting to write a game for/with my son

   =
 Anyway, I haven't abandonned my SLEAT experiments.  Just to 
update, in my=
 first pass it looked like mutation didn't go high 
enough (average result =
was still rising at the highest).  I ran some 
more with higher mutation ra=
tes and they showed the reverse.  So I'm 
thinking that the best area lies =
somewhere between the two sets of 
experiments...

    But at the same time=
 I have discovered a bug where runs that are 
interrupted and resumed are n=
ot producing the same behaviour as ones 
that run right through.  It it cer=
tainly something silly with not 
saving one piece of state from the advance=
d speciation....

    But I need to find a while to debug things.  My guess=
 is that 
this doesn't invalidate the results I have, so sooner or later I'=
ll 
debug it, then press on with a study of mutation rates in the mid-
rang=
e...

rting
